link.title: Photos: Lady Gaga and More at L.A.'s Jingle Ball

link.Abstract: Lady Gaga was the headliner at Jingle Ball, Dec. 9 in New York City. But the event featured more pop stars than you can fit under a Christmas tree. Check out pics of Kelly Clarkson, LMFAO, Demi Lovato, Hot Chelle Rae, Pitbull, Foster the People, David Guetta and more, performing at Madison Square Garden.
link.title: Photos: Kelly Clarkson, Lady Gaga, LMFAO and More Play New York's Jingle Ball

link.Abstract: Ludacris announced plans to open his Chicken & Beer eatery in the Atlanta airport, but he's hardly the first pop star to turn restaurateur. From Lady Gaga to Jay-Z to Bon Jovi we've rounded up some celebs who've found time for menus and music.
link.title: Gallery: Pop Stars With Restaurants

link.title: Follow Dose.ca on Twitter

content.div:
Around 2 p.m. ET today we expected two things to happen:

1) Lady Gaga would announce tour dates for her upcoming Born This Way Ball. (She promised as much last night on Twitter, anyway -- and, true to her word, she Tweeted a link to the first series of dates, 11 spring shows in Asia, New Zealand and Australia. Gaga also wrote that the trek will encompass 110 shows, all told, though Rolling Stone reports that the North American portion of her itinerary won't start until 2013.)

2) Planet Earth will pass through some kind of wormhole, which will zip us back in time by about three months or so.

It was around then that every second celeb news story was about Gagz, right? Because after a short hibernation, the pop star is already back to her old tricks -- read: round-the-clock self-promotion -- and where there's a forthcoming tour announcement, there's bound to be a bevy of promotional ga-ga-oh-ma-ma materials -- which we're all too happy to smash into the news cycle so long as there are millions of people who self-identify as "Little Monsters." Promo stuff like a tour poster and sneak-peeks of Gaga’s upcoming production, and maybe even a slap-dash video for a totes old single, for instance.

Oh, neat! All those things are circulating today.

That's the Born This Way Ball tour poster giving you the spooky stink-eye in the image above. Did you really think we'd post an ad for Value Village's Halloween shop without being paid the appropriate ad rate? Silly, monsters -- though Gaga seems to be very serious about that Castle Frightenstein of hers. Going off other preview tidbits shared by her Ladyship, that Spinal Tap-worthy prop will be a major feature of the production. Earlier this week, Gaga shared a sketch of her new stage set-up, a medieval castle fit for a Frankenstein monster or international pop sensation. There's a standing-room area cordoned off in front of the stage, which Gaga is branding "The Monster Pit" -- presumably a spot that other acts might refer to as a general admission zone, which will, she writes, be "relegated to the fans who have arrived first, waited all night + dressed to 'Ball.'"

Until then, please note that Gaga also found time to release one of her black and white "fashion videos" for the best Shania Twain song in 10 years, "You and I.” It features Gaga in character as the sock-crotch-grabbing Jo Calderone, and that's pretty much it. Watch it below:

Lady Gaga's first run of Born This Way Ball tour dates:

April 27 - Seoul, South Korea

May 2 - Hong Kong

May 10 - Tokyo, Japan

May 28 - Singapore

June 7 - Auckland, NZ

June 13 - Brisbane, Aus

June 20 - Sydney, Aus

June 21 - Sydney, Aus

June 27 - Melbourne, Aus

June 28 - Melbourne, Aus

July 7 - Perth, Aus

leahc@dose.ca

entry.title: Kanye West, Adele Lead Grammy Nominations

link.Abstract: The Grammy nominations were announced Wednesday, and Kanye West leads the pack. Find out who else is up for a Grammy February 12.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: The Grammy nominations were announced Wednesday, and Kanye West leads the pack. Find out who else is up for a Grammy February 12.
link.title: Kanye West

link.Abstract: Consider it a sample of what you can expect on Grammy night, Feb. 12, 2012. The Grammy Nominations Concert took place Nov. 30, 2011 at L.A.'s Nokia Theatre. We've got photos from the event.
link.title: Photos: Inside the Grammy Nominations Concert

link.Abstract: From Taylor Swift's big win to Justin Bieber in Zubaz pants, we're looking back at the most memorable moments of the evening.
link.title: Best and Worst Moments from the AMAs

link.Abstract: Montreal was watching Kanye West and Jay-Z Nov. 22 when the two MCs brought their Watch the Throne tour to the Bell Centre. We've got photos. The Watch the Throne tour continues to Vancouver Dec. 17 and 18.
link.title: Photos: Watch The Throne in Montreal

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift's Speak Now World Tour is at its end. The country-pop star gave the first of two sold-out shows at New York's Madison Square Garden Nov. 21. We've got photos.
link.title: Photos: Taylor Swift at Madison Square Garden

link.Abstract: Selena Gomez! Lady Gaga! Coldplay! A dancing leprechaun! (Oops! That was actually Justin Bieber!) We've got pictures from the 2011 MTV Europe Music Awards, held Nov. 6 in Belfast, Ireland.
link.title: Photos: Inside the 2011 MTV Europe Music Awards

link.Abstract: Lady Gaga vows to channel her inner "Indian hippie" at a press conference in New Delhi.
link.title: Gallery: Lady Gaga in India

link.Abstract: Nicki Minaj is more than just a pretty face. She's also an angry face, a bonkers face ... we could go on. Here are some of the best examples from the MC's new video for "Till the World Ends."
link.title: Gallery: The Many Faces of Nicki Minaj

link.Abstract: Nip-slips, a turkey dinner and more nip-slips. That's how you celebrate Pink Friday! Nicki Minaj's Friday, Aug. 5 performance on Good Morning America was packed with surprises.
link.title: Photos: Nicki Minaj Does Good Morning America

link.Abstract: What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas...but we managed to smuggle out these photos. See pics of Nicki Minaj at the I Heart Radio music festival Sept. 24.
link.title: Photos: Nicki Minaj Plays I Heart Radio Fest

link.Abstract: Lady Gaga made out with Sting, did pilates on a motorcycle/keyboard and danced in her underwear. What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas...but we managed to smuggle out these photos. See pics of Gaga's Sept. 24 set at the I Heart Radio music festival.
link.title: Photos: Lady Gaga Plays I Heart Radio Fest

entry.title: Holy Shat! The 2012 Juno Nominations Are Here

link.Abstract: City and Colour, Dan Mangan, Drake, Feist, Hedley and Nickelback are the top Juno nominees for 2012.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Your 2012 Juno Awards host, William Shatner.
link.title: William Shatner Juno Awards host

link.Abstract: The first round of Juno performers have been revealed. Blue Rodeo, City and Colour, deadmau5 and Feist will play the telecast April 1, 2012.
link.title: Feist, City and Colour, deadmau5, Blue Rodeo Playing 2012 Juno Awards

link.Abstract: The 2012 Juno Awards will take place in Ottawa.
link.title: Juno Awards Coming to Ottawa in 2012; Does This Mean We'll Get a Stephen Harper/Justin Bieber Duet?

link.Abstract: Check out the highlights -- and lowlights -- from the 2011 Juno Awards, which took place in Toronto on March 27, 2011.
link.title: Juno Awards 2011: Best and Worst Moments

link.Abstract: The stars braved the cold on the Juno red carpet. Check out their styles and use the stars below each photo to rate the look.
link.title: Juno Awards 2011: Rate the Fashions

link.Abstract: Neil Young, Shad and Karkwa took home early Juno Awards in the non-televised gala Saturday night in Toronto. See who else brought home a trophy.
link.title: Neil Young, Shad, Karkwa Among Early Juno Winners

link.Abstract: Watch "The Bad in Each Other," the latest video from Feist.
link.title: Feist Premieres New Video, Makes You Feel Feelings

link.Abstract: On the eve of his Canadian tour, City and Colour's Dallas Green chats about how plumbing personal troubles for his music has struck a chord with fans.
link.title: Interview: City and Colour Helping Fans Cope With Their Own 'Little Hells'

link.Abstract: Frontman Jacob Hoggard laughs off talk that the band is maturing and insists they've always written introspective ballads.
link.title: Hedley talks about growing up

link.Abstract: Photos: Feist in Toronto
link.title: Photos: Feist in Toronto

link.Abstract: The day after ringing in 2012 in New York's Times Square, Drake jetted to Las Vegas to play a set at The Joint/Hard Rock Hotel & Casino. YOLO, right? We've got photos from the Jan. 1 show.
link.title: Photos: Drake Takes Care of Las Vegas

entry.content: City and Colour, Dan Mangan, Drake, Feist, Hedley and Nickelback are the top Juno nominees for 2012.

entry.title: Madonna Finally Catches On To That Whole Lady Gaga Plagiarism Thing

link.Abstract: "I thought, 'this is a wonderful way to redo my song,'" The Material Woman tells 20/20 in an interview airing Friday.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: "I thought, 'this is a wonderful way to redo my song,'" The Material Woman tells 20/20 in an interview airing Friday. "I mean, I recognized the chord changes. I thought it was... interesting."
link.title: Madonna

link.Abstract: Madonna's 12th album will be called M.D.N.A. Get it? It's like "Madonna" without the vowels (and that extra letter "N"). Or is it? We've got some theories on what M.D.N.A. stands for.
link.title: What Does Madonna's M.D.N.A. Mean?

link.Abstract: From Madge to Minaj, these are the albums Dose.ca is looking forward to in early 2012.
link.title: Spring 2012 Music Preview

link.Abstract: "I stepped into a soap opera, and I lived in it for quite a long period of my life," the director says.
link.title: Guy Richie Compares Marriage to Madonna to a "Soap Opera"
